page.description: The {PROPGRID} command displays the type of control displayed below. The control provides a mechanism for displaying many prompts and accepting many inputs from the user.

argument.name: Width
argument.description: Numeric. An integer value for the maximum number of characters to display on one line. The actual number displayed may be less because of word wrap.

argument.name: Height
argument.description: Numeric. Optional. Default = 1. The number of rows to display. This may be a fractional number, such as 1.25.

argument.name: PropGrid
argument.description: Pointer. A pointer variable with one of the properties shown below.

case.title: .Def
case.description: Character. A CR-LF delimited list of the categories and items in the property grid. Refer to Property Grid Formatting.

case.title: .Object
case.description: Pointer. Provides access to the Property Grid methods.

section.title: Property Grid Formatting
section.description: A CR-LF delimited list defines the structure and contents of the property grid. Each entry is on its own line. Entries may:

case.description: define the beginning and name of a category
define the state of a category
define the name of an item within a category
define the variable that will contain the user's input

section.description: Define a category with the following 2 character sequence at the beginning of a new line "^^". The name of the category follows these 2 characters. For example: ^^CategoryName. The end of a category is defined by the beginning of a new category or the end of the .Def list. Define the open/closed state of a category by placing one of the following two statements immediately after the category definition.

Define the name of an item with the following 2 character sequence at the beginning of a new line "++". The name of the item follows these 2 characters. For example: ++ItemName. section.title: Example
section.description: Create the variables for the Property Grid object.
section.example: dim pg as P dim pg.settings as P dim pg.def as C dim pg.object as P dim output as P dim output.Item1 as C = "" dim dlg_title as C

section.description: Create the variables to display and respond to the list boxes in this example.
section.example: dim itemList as C = comma_to_crlf("Item,Item2,Item3,Item4,Item5,Item6,Item7,Item8,Item9") dim TargetItem as C = "Item" dim categoryList as C = comma_to_crlf("Category,Category2,Category3") dim TargetCategory as C = "Category" dim dlg_title as C

section.description: Define the structure of the property grid.
section.example: pg.def = <<%str% ^^Category state=opened ++Item var=output.Item1 ++Item2 var=output.Item2 ++Item3 var=output.Item3 ^^Category2 state=closed ++Item4 var=output.Item4 ++Item5 var=output.Item5 ++Item6 var=output.Item6 ^^Category3 state=closed ++Item7 var=output.Item7 ++Item8 var=output.Item8 ++Item9 var=output.Item9 %str%
